Posts.Content: MissyBraddy wrote: I was diag. stage IV from the get-go back in nov. The tumor on my left breast is quite large. My nipple is completely inverted, and there was a clear/yellowish fluid coming out of it. The other night, it was leaking again...but this time, light colored blood coming out. I went and saw my onc. that afternoon. He said it's normal for this to happen with tumors.  WHAT?!  He told me to put gause (sp) on it. Anyone else have this happen??? I have an appt. with a breast surgeon on Wed. to discuss what he thinks (my onc suggested it) I just want this breast off! It hurts alllllll the time...a sharp shooting pain. I have a 6 mos. old, and it's hard to hold her, feed her, etc. This whole thing just makes me MISERABLE at times.Thanks for listening :) Hugs & Hope  ~ Missy Braddy ~ Dx 11/3/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: MissyBraddy wrote: I know it sounds gross, but I wanted to share this. I can across it just googling around. It brought back memories of a story I heard years ago. A friend of mine knew this couple who had a little boy with a terminal illness. The parents got in touch with this Dr. from some other country (sorry, can't recall where exactly) and he suggested urine therapy for their son. The mom and dad both drank their own urine, to get their son to do it.....long story short, it was WORKING. He was improving GREATLY. Anyway, take a look and let me know your thoughts! Here is the link. I don't know how to make it clickable, sorry www.curezone.com/forums/fm.asp?i=1163383  HUGS, Missy  ~ Missy Braddy ~ Dx 11/3/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: warning:kind of gross question. lol MissyBraddy Traci-----TripNeg

Posts.Content: MissyBraddy wrote: I just had a baby girl on sept. 8th and was diagnosed in november. I didn't have a lump until my milk dried up. I was scheduled for a masectomy on the 11th, but my cat scan showed possible liver mets. I went for a PET scan, and I not only have liver mets, I have some bone mets as well. This cancer just blew up from nowhere! I guess I'm considered stage 4....since it has spread? I'm still unclear, I never was actually told I was stage 4, but with everything I have read...... So, right now I am undergoing chemo, just had my 2nd round on the 26TH. The plan is to shrink down these tumors, and I believe possible doing surgery to take my breast off if we can shrink it down ( was 10cm).....seems to be going down a little since these treatments. I've been trying to deal the best I can. I have a wonderful support group of family and friends. The hardest part is not knowing if I will get to see my baby girl grow up, that's what tears me up the most. I have been doing ALOT of praying to the good Lord. I know he is the ultimate healer, and it's all in His hands now. Well, thanks for letting me share, and anyone who is in a similar situation like mine, please let me know and maybe we can chat. God bless you all, and lots of luck in your recoveries. Happy Thanksgiving!!    Missy ~ Missy Braddy ~ Dx 11/3/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
